Question
========
A ball of mass $m$ rolls with speed $v$ towards another ball of mass 
$(`r n[1]`/`r n[2]`)m$ at rest. If the collision is completely inelastic, what is the speed of the
combined mass after the collision?


Answerlist
----------
* $(`r n[1]`/`r n[2]`)v$
* $(`r n[1]`/`r n[1] + n[2]`)v$
* $(`r n[2]`/`r n[1]`)v$
* $(`r n[2]`/`r n[1]+n[2]`)v$



Solution
========
Conservation of momentum

$$m v = \left(m + \frac{`r n[1]`}{`r n[2]`}m \right) v'$$
Solve for $v'$
$$v' = \left(\frac{m}{m + (`r n[1]`/`r n[2]`)m} \right) v = \left(\frac{`r n[2]`}{`r n[1]` + `r n[2]`} \right) v$$
